title: Prosecco Lemon Slush
introduction: Sgroppino is a delightful Venetian dessert that perfectly complements a meal's end with a refreshing twist. This sophisticated, creamy slush combines the tartness of lemon sorbet with the effervescence of prosecco, creating a delightful balance of flavors. It's a treat that's both fun to prepare and enjoyable to serve, particularly in elegant martini glasses. Whether using traditional lemon sorbet or experimenting with orange, this beverage-dessert hybrid is sure to impress.
ingredients: 1 cup very cold prosecco or other dry sparkling wine
instructions: Several hours before you plan to serve the dessert, chill 4 large goblets or parfait glasses in the refrigerator.
Just before serving, remove the sorbet from the freezer. Let stand at room temperature until soft enough to scoop, about 10 minutes. Spoon the sorbet into a medium bowl. Beat until soft and smooth.
Slowly add the prosecco and beat briefly with a whisk until creamy and smooth. Quickly pour the slush into the chilled wine goblets or martini glasses. Garnish with mint. Serve immediately.
variations: Use orange sorbet instead of lemon for a different flavor.
